subject: RE: [junit] TestSetup problem
messageBody:
setup() must be setUp() ?

> -----Original Message-----
> From: llaurick [mailto:llaurick@...]
> Sent: maandag 15 april 2002 16:24
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] TestSetup problem
>
>
> I'm trying to use TestSetup to execute some setup code only once for
> my tests. I've followed the only doc I've found on the TestSetup
> class, the one in the FAQ. (Is there any complete exemple somewhere??)
>
> Here is the class I've made:
>
> public class MyTestCase extends TestCase
> {
>
> public MyTestCase(String name)
> {
> super(name);
> }
>
> public static Test suite()
> {
> System.out.println("MyTestCase.suite->called");
> TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
> suite.addTestSuite(MyTestCase.class);
>
> TestSetup wrapper = new TestSetup(suite) {
> public void setup()
> {
> System.out.println("TestSetup.setup->called");
> }
> };
>
> return wrapper;
> }
>
> public void testOne()
> {
> System.out.println("testOne called");
> assertTrue(true);
> }
>
> public void testTwo()
> {
> System.out.println("testTwo called");
> assertTrue(true);
> }
>
> public static void main(String args[])
> {
> TestRunner.run(suite());
> }
>
>
> The tests are not important, they are there just to see if they are
> being called. The problem I have is that the setup method for the
> wrapper is never called. The output I get for running this test
> (either by using the main or by using -->run test in JBuilder) is:
>
> MyTestCase.suite->called
>
> testOne called
> testTwo called
>
> Time: 0.01
>
> OK (2 tests)
>
>
> Can anyone explain why TestSetup.setup() is never called for the
> inner class?
>
> Thanks in advance,
> Llaurick.
>
>
